title: How to Restore Deleted Contacts on Android

steps.title: Open your Android's Contacts.
steps.content: Open your Android's Contacts. It has an image of a person on it. You should find this app in the App Drawer, or on the Home Screen.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so will invoke a pop-out menu.

steps.title: Tap Contacts to display.
steps.content: Tap Contacts to display . This option should be at the top of the pop-out menu. On some Androids, you may first have to tap Settings and then tap Contacts .

steps.title: Make sure "All contacts" is checked.
steps.content: Make sure "All contacts" is checked. If it isn't, tap it, then look for your missing contacts. If "All Contacts" is checked, however, you'll need to proceed with restoring your deleted contacts.

steps.title: Open the Google Contacts site.
steps.content: Open the Google Contacts site. It's located at https://contacts.google.com/ . This method will only work if you synchronized your Android's contacts with Google. [1] X Research source If you aren't signed into Google Contacts, you'll be prompted to enter your email address and/or password before continuing.

steps.title: Click More.
steps.content: Click More . This tab is on the left side of the page.

steps.title: Click Undo changes.
steps.content: Click Undo changes . It's an option below the More heading. Doing so will invoke a pop-up window with different backup dates: 10 minutes ago 1 hour ago Yesterday 1 week ago Custom - Enter a number of days, hours, and/or minutes to revert back to.

steps.title: Click a backup time.
steps.content: Click a backup time. This will set it as your recovery option. For example, selecting 1 hour ago will restore any contacts you deleted between now and sixty minutes ago. Keep in mind that any contacts you've added between now and the selected recovery point will be removed from your phone.

steps.title: Click CONFIRM.
steps.content: Click CONFIRM . It's in the bottom-right corner of the "Undo changes" window. After a moment, your contacts will be restored.

steps.title: Go to the EaseUS MobiSaver download page.
steps.content: Go to the EaseUS MobiSaver download page. It's at http://www.easeus.com/android-data-recovery-software/free-android-data-recovery.html . If you can't restore your deleted contacts from a Google backup, you'll need to use third-party software to attempt to salvage them.

steps.title: Click the FREE DOWNLOAD button.
steps.content: Click the FREE DOWNLOAD button. This is the blue button in the middle of the page. Doing so will prompt the file to download to your computer.

steps.title: Install MobiSaver.
steps.content: Install MobiSaver. This process will differ depending on your computer type: Windows - Double-click the downloaded setup file, follow the on-screen instructions, and click Finish when MobiSaver finishes installing. Mac - Open the setup file, then drag MobiSaver into your Applications folder.

steps.title: Open MobiSaver if it doesn't automatically open.
steps.content: Open MobiSaver if it doesn't automatically open. To do so, simply double-click the MobiSaver icon, which resembles a blue box.

steps.title: Attach your Android to your computer.
steps.content: Attach your Android to your computer. You'll use the USB charger cable that came with your phone or tablet to do so.

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . This will prompt MobiSaver to begin scanning your Android.

steps.title: Wait for the scan to finish.
steps.content: Wait for the scan to finish. You can monitor the scan's progress by watching the bar at the top of the MobiSaver window.

steps.title: Click the Contacts tab.
steps.content: Click the Contacts tab. It's in the upper-left area of the MobiSaver window.

steps.title: Click the checkboxes next to contacts' names.
steps.content: Click the checkboxes next to contacts' names. If you want to recover every contact listed here, simply click the checkbox next to "Name" at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click Recover.
steps.content: Click Recover . This button is in the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so will bring up a window in which you select a save location for these contacts.

steps.title: Select your Android as a save location.
steps.content: Select your Android as a save location. You should see your Android phone listed as a save location in this window, though you may need to scroll down to see it.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Your contacts will begin restoring to your Android. Don't unplug your computer or your Android until the restoration is complete.
